subject: Re: [junit] A Simple doubt
msgSnippet: Do this instead... public static Test suite(){ TestSuite suite = new TestSuite(TestClass1.class); ^^^^^^^^^^ return suite; } =jason
messageBody:
Do this instead...

public static Test suite(){
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite(TestClass1.class);
^^^^^^^^^^
return suite;
}

=jason

On Thu, 2003-05-22 at 08:33, binukuttickattu wrote:
> Dear friends,
> I am new to Junit. Please help me find out the pblm with this.
> I have a class names Package1Class1 in package unittest.package1.
> This class has a function for adding two integers.
> I wrote a testclass for the same. Whenever I try to run this, I
> get this problem which is confusing.
> public class Package1Class1 {
> int x,y;
> public Package1Class1(int c,int d) {
> x=c;y=d;
> }
> public int add(){
> return x+y;
> }
> }
>
> And my Test class is
> public class TestClass1 extends TestCase{
> private Package1Class1 cls1 = new Package1Class1(2,3);
> private Package1Class1 cls2 = new Package1Class1(3,2);
>
> public TestClass1(String args) {
> super(args);
> }
> public void testAdd(){
> int expected1 = cls1.add();
> int expected2 = cls2.add();
> System.out.println(expected1);
> assertEquals(expected1,expected2);
> }
> public static Test suite(){
> TestSuite suite = new TestSuite(Package1Class1.class);
> return suite;
> }
> public static void main(String args[]) {
> junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
> }
> }
>
> This is the error.. coming when I try to run the test.
>
> ) warning(junit.framework.TestSuite$1)
> junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Class
> unittest.package1.Package1Class1 has no public constructor TestCase
> (String name) or TestCase()
>
> at unittest.package1.TestClass1.main(TestClass1.java:49)
>
>
>
> FAILURES!!!
>
> Tests run: 1, Failures: 1, Errors: 0
>
>
> Why JUnit is telling me to add TestClass1(String ss) constructor in
> Package1Class1, when there is no relation between them.
>
> Thanks in Advance
> Binu K Idicula
>
